headline: Prediction: Buying Rivian Stock Today Could Set You Up for Life
summary: Rivian is about to reach an inflection point for growth.  There may never be another Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA).  Tesla's high-profile leader, Elon Musk, has pushed the company into many lucrative verticals, everything from electric vehicles and solar power to distributed energy and robotaxis.

headline: Tesla Stock Tanks. Musk’s Trump Break Just Keeps Getting Wider.
summary: Tesla  stock slipped Wednesday, after more weak sales data and a public disagreement between CEO Elon Musk and President Donald Trump.  In the latter, Tesla sold 1,210 cars in May, down 36% year over year.  In China, May shipments from Tesla’s Shanghai plant totaled nearly 62,000 cars, representing a 15% year-over-year decline.

headline: Tesla May sales fall in big European markets ahead of new Model Y deliveries
summary: Tesla sales have plunged in some European markets and in China, as customers have favoured Chinese EVs because of their competitive prices and in some cases in protest at Musk's political activities.  In an email sent to some media outlets late on Tuesday, a spokesman for Tesla in Britain said the decline in May sales was because the automaker had sold its stock of old Model Y cars as it awaited the new version from its factory in Berlin.  Tesla has been "comfortably taking orders from customers" for the new Model Y in Britain, "with an increase expected" for its June sales, the spokesman wrote.

raw.headline: Tesla May sales fall in big European markets ahead of new Model Y deliveries

Tesla has been "comfortably taking orders from customers" for the new Model Y in Britain, "with an increase expected" for its June sales, the spokesman wrote.

headline: Tesla's China-made EV sales fall 15% y/y in May
summary: BEIJING (Reuters) -A decline in Tesla's China-made electric vehicle sales extended to an eighth month in May, as the U.S. automaker's sales woes were compounded by brutal price wars in the world's largest auto market.  Deliveries of China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles, including both domestic sales and exports to Europe and other markets, fell 15% in May from a year earlier to 61,662 vehicles, after a 6% fall in April, data from the China Passenger Car Association showed on Wednesday.  Tesla's EV sales rout also continued across much of Europe last month, as its aging model lineup and CEO Elon Musk's political activities deterred buyers.

raw.headline: Tesla's China-made EV sales fall 15% y/y in May
raw.summary: BEIJING (Reuters) -A decline in Tesla's China-made electric vehicle sales extended to an eighth month in May, as the U.S. automaker's sales woes were compounded by brutal price wars in the world's largest auto market.  Deliveries of China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles, including both domestic sales and exports to Europe and other markets, fell 15% in May from a year earlier to 61,662 vehicles, after a 6% fall in April, data from the China Passenger Car Association showed on Wednesday.  Tesla's EV sales rout also continued across much of Europe last month, as its aging model lineup and CEO Elon Musk's political activities deterred buyers.

headline: Tesla Stock vs. Apple Stock: Wall Street Says Buy One and Sell the Other
summary: Shares of Apple and Tesla have fallen sharply this year, but most Wall Street analysts expect Apple to rebound while Tesla keeps moving lower.  Apple is the market leader in smartphone sales, but the company faces headwinds related to antitrust lawsuits, tariffs, and investments in AI infrastructure.  Tesla lost substantial market share in electric car sales in the first quarter, but the company has important opportunities in autonomous driving and robotics.
